name: Characters in Literary Titles Quiz / Test | Mixed Literature | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Hermann Hesse.

	Two of his lesser known works. He's better known for 'Siddhartha' and 'Steppenwolf'.

questions.text: Which of the following works is not a SHORT STORY (and name of a character) by Edgar Allan Poe?

questions.explanation:
Tobias Smollett.

	'The Expedition of Sir Humphrey Clinker'. (No kidding.) Melville wrote 'Billy Budd'.

Laurence Sterne.

	His masterpiece, they say. Fielding did 'Tom Jones'. Thackeray did 'Barry Lyndon'.

Oscar Wilde.

	Shaw did 'Saint Joan' (about Joan of Arc). Wilde (in my opinion) had one outstanding play ('Importance of Being Earnest'), one outstanding novel ('Picture of Dorian Gray'), one outstanding poem ('Ballad of Reading Gaol') and one outstanding memoir ('De Profundis'). Interesting.

Nikolai Gogol.

	It became a fairly good movie with Tony Curtis and Yul Brynner. Pasternak did 'Dr. Zhivago'.

questions.text: Who is the author of 'Cass Timberlane' and 'Ann Vickers'?
questions.explanation:
Sinclair Lewis.

	Not his best-known works. He's better known for 'Main Street' and 'Arrowsmith'. Faulkner wrote about 'Absalom' and Fitzgerald wrote about 'Gatsby'.

Joseph Conrad.

	Conrad also did 'Lord Jim'. Defoe did 'Robiinson Crusoe'. James did 'Daisy Miller'. Swift wrote about 'Gulliver'.

questions.text: What author wrote about a girl of the streets named Maggie?
questions.explanation:
Stephen Crane.

	'Maggie, A Girl of the Streets'. Dreiser wrote about 'Carrie'.

Richard Lovelace.

	'Stone walls do not a prison make ...'
